author: Cara Lombardo
title: Clorox to Buy Dietary-Supplement Maker Nutranext for $700 Million
text:
Clorox Co. plans to buy a dietary-supplement maker for about $700 million, the company said Monday, as the owner of Pine-Sol cleaner and Hidden Valley dressing continues to diversify its business with a focus on health and wellness.
Nutranext, based in Sunrise, Fla., makes products such as Rainbow Light multivitamins, Natural Vitality specialty minerals, and Neocell supplements for hair, skin and nails. Nutranextâ€™s sales were about $200 million last year, Clorox said, with 90% in the U.S.
...
